intro: Spyridium tridentatum, commonly known as the three-toothed spyridium, is a flowering plant native to south-eastern Australia. It belongs to the Rhamnaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers that bloom in spring. The plant has small, oval-shaped leaves with three distinct teeth along the edges, giving it its common name. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in heathlands and open forests. Spyridium tridentatum is a hardy, low-maintenance plant that is popular in native gardens due to its ornamental value and ecological benefits.
